alert.note: Alert for West Central Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 04 at 5:08PM MST until January 04 at 11:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations up to 1 to 2 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...West Central Mountains. * WHEN...Until 11 PM MST this evening. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Tire traction will be reduced. Extend the distance between your vehicle and the vehicle in front of you. This includes portions of Interstate 40 near the Continental Divide. The hazardous conditions could impact the evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Areas of blowing snow may significantly reduce visibility at times.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For the latest road conditions, dial 511 or 1.800.432.4269, or visit http://nmroads.com.
